oai_dc:dc.dc:title: OVERTOPPING ON RUBBLE MOUND BREAKWATERS FOR LOW STEEPNESS WAVES IN DEEP AND DEPTH LIMITED CONDITIONS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Christensen, Nicole Færch
R¸ge, Mads S¸nderstrup
Thomsen, Jonas Bjerg
Andersen, Thomas Lykke
Burcharth, Hans Falk
N¸rgaard, Jorgen Quvang Harck
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: overtopping
conventional rubble mound breakwater
berm breakwater
long waves
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this paper, the investigation of overtopping on rubble mound breakwaters for low steepness waves in both deep and shallow-water conditions are presented. The existing formulae provide quite different results for long waves for both conventional and berm breakwaters. Therefore, new model tests with focus on long waves have been performed for both types of breakwaters. The new model tests showed some deviation from the formulae. Therefore, limitations in the use of the present methods and an update for one of the methods are presented.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 34 (2014): Proceedings of 34th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Seoul, Korea, 2014; structures.6
